resources.string: On the other side of the Southwest, on the shores of Cauca\'s river, is placed La Pintada, the youngest town of Antioquia, tourist in a 100%.

Its climate is hot, as any other land close to the Cauca\'s river, and it has some hotels, swimming pools, some night relaxation places. Besides, the practice of ecotourism has increased as well as extreme sports such as: kayaking, rafting and tail biking, and so on.

This is a land of natural, patrimonial and human wealth. It offers some touristic activities related to the coffee culture. In its farms, traditional meals and good tasting, spontaneous and natural goodness from Antioquia\'s people is reflected.

Programed by:
Luis David Goyes Garcés.
luis.goyes@udea.edu.co
Electronic Engineering Student
Universidad de Antioquia
Press option button to see some interesting information about La Pintada
There is a lot of hotels in La Pintada, among them we can call:

Comfortable rooms with air conditioning and fan, cable TV and private bathroom. Restaurant and Bar services. Swimming pool, hammock zone, board games, playpen. Football and Volleyball fields. Private parking.

Lodging for 24 hours, in cabins for couples or relatives. We offer perfect room service, bar service, Swimming pool for adults and kids, sauna, jacuzzi, board games, restaurant, night club. Rooms with fan or air conditioning, TV cable, private bathroom. Lodging with food service.
Address: 200 mts by \'La Pintada - Puente Iglesias\' route
Rooms and cabins with fan and TV cable. Restaurant service, swimming pool, board games, toboggan
32 rooms and 16 villas for 4 people each, provided with air conditioning, TV set and minibar.
La pintada, as touristic town, has many bars, restaurants and night clubs, among them:
Address: 3th km by \'La Pintada - Manizales\' route
La Pintada has some touristic places, such as:
This bridge was set to connect Antioquia to the southern country. It was declared department monument.

Construction made of stone, opened in 1933. Receives its name in honor to the engineer Alejandro López, la Quiebra\'s tunnel designer. It served as connection between Antioquia\'s railroad and Western railroad.

It has a height of 1,453 meters and a rich pre-Hispanic past that evidences ceramic remaiders and petroglyphs or stone inscriptions. On the mountain, there is a beautiful view of the region, including the majestic headlands and rivers. The sport of paragliding is also practiced. It is the epicenter of ecological walks by any kind of visitor.
La Pintada is placed over 600 mamsl and it\'s mean temperature is 27ºC.
